example.userPrompt: Generate a summary of the #frontend-sprint channel's activity from the last week, highlighting key decisions, resolved issues, new blockers, and any pending action items relevant for our project sync meeting.

tasks.description: As a Product Manager, create a simple, multiple-choice poll within Slack to gather quick team feedback or facilitate a decision. This variation focuses on a common use case for immediate input on a specific topic.

example.scenario: A Product Manager needs to quickly get the team's preference on two potential names for an upcoming feature release. They want a straightforward poll to consolidate opinions before a final decision.
example.userPrompt: Create a Slack poll asking the team to vote for their preferred feature name between 'Horizon' and 'Vanguard'. Add a note encouraging them to consider market appeal and brand fit.

tasks.task: Create and customize anonymous polls in Slack for team feedback
tasks.description: As a Product Manager, learn to effectively utilize Slack's native or integrated poll features to gather quick, anonymous feedback from your team on feature ideas, design choices, or process improvements. This variation focuses on setting up polls that ensure unbiased input and manage voting preferences.

example.scenario: A Product Manager needs to gather anonymous feedback from cross-functional teams on two potential solutions for a challenging technical problem, wanting to ensure everyone feels comfortable sharing their honest opinion without fear of judgment, and to prevent any single person from swaying the vote.
example.userPrompt: How can I set up an anonymous poll in Slack asking 'Which technical approach do you prefer for scalability issues?' with options 'Solution A (Microservices)', 'Solution B (Monolithic Refactor)', and 'Other (Please specify in thread)', and ensure that voters cannot see who voted for what, nor change their vote once submitted?

tasks.task: Draft a comprehensive meeting follow-up in Slack
tasks.description: Summarize key discussion points, decisions, action items, and next steps from a recent meeting into a clear and concise Slack message. Ensure all stakeholders are tagged, deadlines are specified, and relevant links (e.g., to notes, shared documents) are included for easy reference. This task emphasizes clarity and actionable communication, crucial for maintaining momentum and alignment within product teams.

example.scenario: You've just concluded a crucial Product Review meeting for the new 'Feature X' where several key decisions were made, and action items assigned to various team members. You need to send a follow-up to the #product-x-team channel to ensure everyone is aligned and clear on next steps, referring to specific documents.
example.userPrompt: Generate a Slack meeting follow-up for the #product-x-team channel regarding the 'Feature X' Product Review meeting. Key decisions: proceed with UI redesign based on user feedback, deprioritize 'Feature Y' for now. Action items: @Alice to finalize UI mockups by EOD Friday (link to Figma), @Bob to update backlog with new priorities by Wednesday, @Carol to schedule dev kick-off for Feature X next Monday. Remind everyone to review the updated Product Requirements Document (link provided in notes). Ask if anyone has questions.

tasks.task: Create a quick feedback poll in Slack
tasks.description: As a Product Manager, create a simple and quick poll in Slack to gather immediate team feedback on a minor decision, a preferred meeting time, or a preliminary feature idea without needing a dedicated survey tool.

example.scenario: You're a Product Manager and need to quickly decide on the best time for an ad-hoc sync-up meeting about a new sprint task. Instead of an email thread, you want to use Slack to get team consensus rapidly.
example.userPrompt: How do I create a simple poll in Slack to find out the preferred meeting time among three options (10 AM, 2 PM, 4 PM EST) for a quick sync-up today, and ensure everyone can easily vote?

tasks.task: Summarize Slack Channel Discussions for Decision Making
tasks.description: As a Product Manager, synthesize key decisions, action items, and open questions from recent discussions within specific Slack channels to prepare for a stakeholder update or review meeting. This involves sifting through messages, threads, and reactions to extract the most relevant information without reading every single message.

example.scenario: A Product Manager needs to provide a concise update on the progress of a feature development to senior stakeholders. The bulk of recent discussions, design reviews, and engineering updates have taken place across three key Slack channels: '#feature-x-development', '#design-reviews', and '#engineering-sync'. The PM needs to quickly get up to speed on the main points, identified blockers, and decided next steps without sifting through hundreds of messages manually for the past week.
example.userPrompt: Summarize the key decisions, action items, and outstanding blockers from the #feature-x-development, #design-reviews, and #engineering-sync channels over the past 7 days. Focus on actionable insights that would be relevant for a stakeholder update. Include any major points of disagreement or unresolved questions.

tasks.task: Synthesize Key Decisions and Action Items from Cross-Channel Slack Discussions for Strategic Review
tasks.description: As a Product Manager, this task involves thoroughly reviewing and synthesizing extensive discussions across multiple, related Slack channels to extract critical decisions made, identify open questions or unresolved blockers, and consolidate actionable next steps. This particular variation focuses on preparing a strategic overview or retrospective for leadership, requiring a deep understanding of context, identification of dependencies, and the ability to present complex information concisely and informatively.
tasks.mode: Analysis and Synthesis (potentially AI-assisted via plugins)

example.scenario: A Product Manager needs to prepare a comprehensive summary of a critical feature's development progress, decisions, and challenges for an upcoming quarterly leadership review. The discussions have been spread across #product-design-featureX, #engineering-featureX, and #ux-research-featureX over the past month. The goal is to provide a concise yet detailed overview of what's been decided, what's still pending, and any major blockers or pivots that occurred.
example.userPrompt: As a Product Manager, I need to synthesize the past month's discussions in #product-design-featureX, #engineering-featureX, and #ux-research-featureX. Please identify all key decisions made, unresolved issues or blockers, significant pivots or changes in direction, and consolidated next steps, along with their owners. This summary is for a strategic leadership review, so focus on the 'why' behind major outcomes and any critical dependencies.

tasks.description: Efficiently create a concise summary of recent conversations within a specific Slack channel to quickly catch up on updates, decisions, and action items, especially useful for product managers needing to stay informed without reading every message.

example.scenario: A Product Manager returns from a week-long vacation and needs to quickly get up to speed on all ongoing discussions within the #product_discovery and #engineering_updates channels. They want to understand the main points, key decisions, and any critical action items without sifting through thousands of messages.
example.userPrompt: Summarize the key discussions in #product_discovery and #engineering_updates from the last week, highlighting major decisions, blockers, and next steps.

tasks.description: A Product Manager needs to quickly understand the core outcomes, decisions, or blockers from lengthy Slack channel discussions without reading every message. This helps in staying updated, preparing for meetings, or tracking feature progress efficiently, especially after absences or during busy periods.

example.scenario: A Product Manager returns from a client meeting and needs to quickly get up to speed on the progress and discussions within the #alpha-feature-launch channel before their next sync meeting with the development team. They can't read through hundreds of messages.
example.userPrompt: Summarize the #alpha-feature-launch channel discussions from the last 24 hours, highlighting key decisions made, identified blockers, and any new action items assigned.

tasks.description: As a Product Manager, you need to break down a high-level user story or epic into actionable sub-tasks within Jira. This often involves thinking through the various technical, design, and testing steps required for completion, ensuring clarity for the development team.

example.scenario: A Product Manager has a user story in Jira titled 'As a user, I want to be able to reset my password via email so I can regain access to my account.' They need to generate a comprehensive list of sub-tasks for the development team to implement this feature, covering all necessary steps from backend to frontend and testing.
example.userPrompt: Generate a detailed list of sub-tasks for the Jira user story: 'As a user, I want to be able to reset my password via email so I can regain access to my account.' Consider development (backend/frontend), database, testing, and potential security aspects.

tasks.task: Generate Sub-Tasks for a Jira Epic or Story
tasks.description: The Product Manager needs to break down a larger Jira item (Epic or Story) into smaller, actionable sub-tasks. The AI tool will assist by suggesting relevant sub-tasks based on the parent item's description, common agile practices, and typical development workflows (e.g., UI, API, database, testing).

example.scenario: A Product Manager has created a new Jira Story titled 'Implement User Profile Settings' with a detailed description. They need to quickly generate a comprehensive list of development sub-tasks for this story to facilitate sprint planning and estimation.
example.userPrompt: Generate a list of detailed sub-tasks for the Jira Story 'Implement User Profile Settings'. The story description is: 'As a registered user, I want to be able to view and update my personal profile information, including my full name, email address, password, and optionally upload a profile picture. This requires secure authentication, validation, and persistence of data. Consider frontend, backend, and database changes.'

tasks.task: Generate detailed sub-tasks for a complex Jira Story/Epic with cross-functional dependencies
tasks.description: As a Product Manager, you need to break down a high-level Jira Story or Epic into detailed, actionable sub-tasks. This variation focuses on a complex feature that requires careful consideration of technical, design, and QA aspects, often involving multiple teams or external integrations. The goal is to ensure all necessary steps are identified for development, testing, and deployment, including potential blockers or dependencies.

example.scenario: You are the Product Manager for an e-commerce platform. A new high-priority Epic, 'Implement Guest Checkout with One-Time Password (OTP) Verification', has been approved. This feature requires updates to the user authentication service, front-end UI changes, integration with an SMS/email OTP provider, and careful consideration of error handling and security. You need to create a comprehensive list of sub-tasks for this Epic, ensuring all development, QA, design, and deployment aspects are covered, including potential dependencies on other teams or third-party services.
example.userPrompt: Generate a detailed list of Jira sub-tasks for the Epic 'Implement Guest Checkout with One-Time Password (OTP) Verification'. Include sub-tasks for front-end development, back-end API changes, integration with an external OTP service, UI/UX design, QA testing (functional, security, performance), error handling, logging, deployment, and documentation. Consider potential dependencies on the authentication team and external vendors. Ensure each sub-task is actionable and clearly describes the work involved.

tasks.description: As a Product Manager, you need to quickly grasp the essence of lengthy discussion threads within Jira tickets to provide updates, make decisions, or brief stakeholders. This involves distilling multiple comments from various team members into concise, actionable summaries, identifying key points, decisions made, and remaining open questions.

example.scenario: A critical bug ticket (#PROJ-456) has accumulated over 50 comments from developers, QA, and support over the past week. Your engineering lead needs a 2-minute verbal summary of the current status, root cause findings, and the agreed-upon next steps for the daily stand-up.
example.userPrompt: Summarize the discussion thread for Jira ticket PROJ-456. Include the main issue, key findings or decisions made, who is responsible for what, and the agreed-upon next steps. Keep it concise for a verbal update.

tasks.task: Summarize lengthy Jira ticket threads for stakeholder updates
tasks.description: Synthesize complex and long-running Jira ticket comment threads into concise, actionable summaries. This is particularly useful for Product Managers who need to quickly disseminate key information, update stakeholders, or prepare for meetings without having to read through dozens of comments.

example.scenario: A Product Manager is preparing for a weekly leadership sync and needs to provide a quick update on the progress and current status of a critical feature's development, which has a very active Jira ticket with over 50 comments detailing various discussions and blockers. They need to extract the most pertinent information.
example.userPrompt: Summarize the entire comment thread of Jira ticket [PROD-4567]. Focus on the key discussion points, any technical challenges encountered, decisions made regarding scope or implementation, and the current overall status or next steps. The summary should be suitable for a high-level stakeholder update, highlighting critical information and avoiding excessive technical jargon.

tasks.task: Generate sub-tasks for a user story in Jira
tasks.description: As a Product Manager, break down a high-level user story into a comprehensive list of actionable, well-defined sub-tasks within Jira. This involves identifying all necessary steps for design, backend development, frontend development, testing, and deployment/release to ensure the user story can be effectively executed by the development team.

example.scenario: A Product Manager has finalized a user story for a new feature and needs to prepare it for a sprint by creating all necessary sub-tasks in Jira for the development team.
example.userPrompt: You are a Product Manager. The following user story has been approved: 'As a registered user, I want to be able to save my favorite articles, so that I can easily revisit them later.' Generate a detailed list of actionable sub-tasks that would be created in Jira for this user story. Include tasks for backend, frontend, testing, and any necessary design or infrastructure work.

tasks.description: Formulate Jira Query Language (JQL) statements to filter, search, and report on issues within Jira. This is crucial for Product Managers to track feature progress, identify blockers, analyze issue trends, monitor sprint health, and prepare comprehensive reports for stakeholders.

example.scenario: A Product Manager needs to assess the progress of all high-priority user stories and bugs related to the 'User Onboarding' feature that were planned for the current sprint, excluding any that have been moved to 'Done' or 'Closed' status, to prepare for a stakeholder update.
example.userPrompt: As a Product Manager, I need a JQL query that retrieves all 'Story' and 'Bug' issue types with 'High' or 'Highest' priority, linked to the 'User Onboarding' component, assigned to the current active sprint, and whose status is not 'Done' or 'Closed'.

tasks.description: As a Product Manager, facilitate a collaborative session in Figma to visually map out and iterate on core user flows for a new product feature or an enhanced user journey. This involves identifying key user steps, decision points, potential alternative paths, and areas for improvement, often incorporating input from design, engineering, and UX research.

example.scenario: The product team is developing a new 'Smart Budgeting' feature for a personal finance app. As the Product Manager, you need to lead a session to map out how users will discover, set up, and manage their smart budgets, ensuring an intuitive and engaging experience.
example.userPrompt: Let's brainstorm and map out the primary user flows for our new 'Smart Budgeting' feature in Figma. We need to cover initial setup, ongoing management, and potential notifications or alerts. Focus on identifying key decision points and opportunities for delight.

tasks.task: Brainstorm User Flows for a New Feature
tasks.description: As a Product Manager, lead a collaborative brainstorming session in Figma to define and visualize the end-to-end user journeys and key interaction points for a new product feature. Focus on edge cases and alternative paths, using Figma's whiteboard capabilities to map out the flow.

example.scenario: Your team is developing a new 'AI-powered summary' feature for a content management platform. As the Product Manager, you need to facilitate a brainstorming session to outline how users will discover, activate, use, and potentially disable this feature, considering different user types and potential error states. You plan to use Figma's FigJam or a blank canvas for this session.
example.userPrompt: Set up a new Figma file. Brainstorm the core user flow for integrating an 'AI-powered summary' feature into our content platform. Start with discovery, activation, usage, and deactivation. Consider edge cases like 'no content available' or 'summary generation failure'. Document key decision points and alternative paths visually.

tasks.task: Brainstorm User Flows for a New Feature
tasks.description: As a Product Manager, define and visualize the key user journeys and interactions within a new product feature using Figma. This involves mapping out steps, decision points, and potential pain points from a user's perspective to inform design and development, ensuring a smooth and intuitive experience.

example.scenario: A Product Manager is tasked with defining the user experience for a new 'Personalized Recipe Recommendation' feature within an existing food delivery app. They need to visualize how a user would discover, interact with, and save recommendations.
example.userPrompt: As a Product Manager, I'm defining the user flows for a new 'Personalized Recipe Recommendation' feature in our food delivery app. Help me brainstorm the core user journey, from discovering the feature to saving a recipe. Outline key steps, decision points, and potential areas for friction. Suggest a structure for how I might lay this out in Figma.

tasks.description: As a Product Manager, you need to define the different states and properties of UI components (e.g., buttons, input fields, cards) to ensure clarity for designers and developers. This task involves structuring a core UI element in Figma using component variants to represent its various attributes, ensuring consistency and reusability within the design system.

example.scenario: You are a Product Manager overseeing a new feature development. The design team has provided initial mockups, and you realize that a core UI element, such as a 'Button', needs to have multiple states (e.g., Primary, Secondary, Disabled, Hover) and sizes (e.g., Small, Medium, Large) defined clearly for both designers and developers. You need to prepare a structured component for this.
example.userPrompt: Define and create the 'Button' component in Figma, establishing its properties for 'Type' (Primary, Secondary), 'State' (Default, Hover, Disabled), and 'Size' (Small, Medium, Large) using component variants. Ensure naming conventions are clear and logical for team collaboration.

tasks.description: As a Product Manager, you need to define and structure component variants in Figma for a critical UI element, specifically focusing on different interactive states and content configurations to ensure consistency and development readiness. This involves consolidating existing design elements into a scalable component set.

example.scenario: You are overseeing the development of a new navigation bar for a web application. The design team has provided initial mockups, but developers need clear specifications for how the navigation items behave in different states (hover, active, disabled) and adapt to varying content lengths (e.g., notification counts). You need to create a comprehensive component set in Figma to cover these scenarios for developer hand-off and future scalability.
example.userPrompt: As a Product Manager, I need to create a 'Navigation Item' component in Figma. This component should have variants for its 'State' (Default, Hover, Active, Disabled) and 'Badge' (None, Unread, New Message). Ensure the variants handle text truncation gracefully and include an icon slot. Organize these variants logically within the component set.

tasks.task: Define comprehensive component variants for a new interactive element
tasks.description: As a Product Manager, define a complete set of component variants within Figma for a new, complex interactive UI element (e.g., an advanced data table, a multi-step form, or a specialized modal). This involves specifying different states (e.g., default, hover, active, disabled, loading, empty, error), sizes, and configurations using Figma's component properties to ensure developer clarity and design system consistency. This task focuses on a more advanced or 'edge case' variant definition, building upon basic component creation, and considering complex user flows.

example.scenario: The design team has delivered the initial basic component for a new 'Advanced Search Filter' module. As the Product Manager, you need to work within Figma to meticulously define all necessary component variants, including states for active filters, selected options, disabled states, error messages for invalid input, and different layout configurations (e.g., collapsed vs. expanded). This definition must be thorough, anticipating all user interactions and edge cases, to facilitate precise developer handoff and ensure a robust user experience.
example.userPrompt: Define and organize all component variants for the 'Advanced Search Filter' module in Figma. This includes specifying active/inactive states, selected/unselected options, disabled states, input error states, and responsive layout variants (collapsed/expanded). Ensure clear naming conventions and property definitions for easy developer consumption and design system integration.

tasks.description: As a Product Manager, define and implement component variants in Figma to ensure design system consistency and improve designer-developer handoff. This involves understanding different states, sizes, and types of components required for a feature or product area, and setting them up correctly within Figma's variant properties.

example.scenario: A new feature requires a reusable 'Card' component with multiple design permutations (e.g., with/without image, different content layouts, active/inactive states). As the PM, you need to ensure the design team has a robust and flexible component in Figma to work with, which includes setting up its variants.
example.userPrompt: Define and create the Figma component variants for our 'Product Card' component. We need variants for cards with and without an image, two different content layouts (standard and compact), and 'Default', 'Hover', and 'Selected' states for each. Structure the variants logically for easy consumption by designers and developers.

tasks.description: As a Product Manager, define and oversee the creation of component variants within Figma for a design system. This involves specifying different states (e.g., default, hover, active), sizes, types, and other properties for UI components like buttons, input fields, or cards, ensuring they are robust, scalable, and meet user experience requirements while aligning with product goals. This task often includes collaborating with designers and engineers to ensure feasibility and consistent implementation.

example.scenario: A Product Manager is leading the development of a new feature that requires an updated set of interactive UI components. They need to ensure that the design system in Figma can support various states and functionalities of these components without creating a fragmented user experience or increasing developer overhead.
example.userPrompt: As a Product Manager, how should I approach creating component variants in Figma for our new design system to ensure scalability, maintainability, and consistent user experience across different product features?

tasks.task: Brainstorm user flows for a new feature
tasks.description: As a Product Manager, you need to lead a brainstorming session in Figma to map out and refine user flows for an upcoming feature or product improvement. This involves collaborating with design and engineering to ensure the flows are intuitive, technically feasible, and align with product goals.

example.scenario: Your team is developing a new 'Smart Playlist Creator' feature for an existing music streaming app. You need to visualize how users will discover, configure, save, and manage these smart playlists.
example.userPrompt: As the Product Manager, open a new Figma board. Invite your lead designer and a senior engineer. Start by defining the core user stories for creating a smart playlist (e.g., 'As a user, I want to create a smart playlist based on genre and mood'). Then, facilitate a brainstorming session using shapes, arrows, and text to map out the primary user flow, including entry points, configuration steps (e.g., selecting criteria like genre, mood, tempo, artist), previewing results, saving, and accessing saved playlists. Ensure to consider edge cases like an empty playlist or invalid criteria.

tasks.description: As a Product Manager, define the requirements and oversee the creation of scalable component variants within Figma for a new design system or feature. This involves understanding user needs and product requirements to define various states (e.g., default, hover, active, disabled), sizes (e.g., small, medium, large), and types (e.g., primary, secondary, ghost) for core UI components. The goal is to ensure the design team accurately implements these as Figma component variants, optimizing for developer handoff, consistency, and future maintainability.

example.scenario: Your product is undergoing a major UI refresh, and you need to establish a comprehensive set of input field components. As the Product Manager, you must clearly define the different states (e.g., empty, filled, focused, error, disabled) and potential types (e.g., text, number, password, search) for these input fields. You then need to guide the design team to structure these as Figma component variants to ensure developers receive clear specifications and the design system remains robust.
example.userPrompt: Outline the full range of input field component variants needed for the UI refresh. Specify the different states and types, including any unique properties for each. Provide a brief explaining the functional need for each variant to the design team, ensuring they understand how to structure these within Figma using component properties and variants effectively for a scalable design system.

tasks.description: As a Product Manager, create or refine user experience microcopy for a new feature or interaction flow directly within a Figma prototype. This involves crafting concise, clear, and on-brand text for elements like buttons, error messages, tooltips, empty states, and success notifications to enhance usability and user comprehension.

example.scenario: A Product Manager is reviewing a new 'File Upload' feature in a Figma prototype. The current microcopy for the success message is generic ('File uploaded successfully.') and the empty state for the file list is blank. They need more engaging and helpful copy.
example.userPrompt:
As a Product Manager, I'm working on a file upload feature in Figma. I need UX microcopy for two specific states: 
1. A success message after a user uploads a file. It should confirm the upload and suggest the next step (e.g., 'view file' or 'share').
2. An empty state message for the file list when no files have been uploaded yet. It should encourage the user to upload their first file. 

Keep it concise, friendly, and align with a professional productivity tool. The target audience values efficiency and clarity. Provide 2-3 options for each.

tasks.task: Generate UX Microcopy for a Product Feature
tasks.description: As a Product Manager, leverage AI to generate clear, concise, and on-brand UX microcopy directly within Figma prototypes or design files. This task focuses on crafting small pieces of text – such as button labels, error messages, form field instructions, success notifications, or onboarding hints – that guide users and enhance the overall product experience. The goal is to ensure consistency, improve usability, and align with product objectives, thereby optimizing user flows and reducing friction.

example.scenario: You are reviewing the latest Figma prototype for a new 'Subscription Upgrade' flow. The design team has provided the layout, but specific UX microcopy is needed for the call-to-action on the upgrade button, a confirmation message after a successful upgrade, and a clear, empathetic message if the upgrade fails due to a payment issue. As the PM, you need to ensure this microcopy is persuasive, reassuring, and provides clear next steps.
example.userPrompt: Generate UX microcopy for a 'Subscription Upgrade' flow in Figma. I need a compelling label for an 'Upgrade Now' button, a success message for a completed upgrade that highlights new features, and an actionable error message for a failed payment. The tone should be professional and encouraging, guiding the user seamlessly.

tasks.description: As a Product Manager, prepare concise summaries of data sets to be presented as charts in PowerPoint, ensuring key insights and actionable information are highlighted for stakeholders.

example.scenario: You are preparing a quarterly business review (QBR) presentation for the executive leadership. You have several detailed spreadsheets containing product usage metrics, sales figures, and customer feedback. Before creating the actual charts in PowerPoint, you need to distill the most important data points and trends that each chart will visualize.
example.userPrompt: Given the attached Q3 product performance data (CSV format) and customer acquisition cost (CAC) report, summarize the critical insights for a PowerPoint presentation. Specifically, identify the top 3 product features by usage, the average daily active users (DAU) growth rate, the most significant change in CAC, and any key regional sales disparities, providing the summarized data points that would form the basis for each chart.

roles.role: Product Manager, Project Manager, Business Analyst, Marketing Manager

tasks.task: Draft a Project Proposal in Google Docs
tasks.description: Develop a comprehensive project proposal document using Google Docs. This task involves outlining project goals, scope, deliverables, timeline, budget, and key stakeholders. It requires research, structuring information, drafting content, and formatting the document for clarity and professionalism, often incorporating feedback from collaborators.
tasks.roles: Product Manager, Project Manager, Business Analyst, Marketing Manager

example.scenario: A Product Manager needs to present a new product feature idea to senior leadership and engineering teams. They must create a formal proposal to secure resources and approval for the project.
example.userPrompt: As a Product Manager, you need to draft a detailed proposal in Google Docs for a new 'AI-powered personalized content feed' feature. Structure the document to include an executive summary, problem statement, proposed solution, market analysis, technical overview, success metrics, resource requirements, and a projected timeline. Ensure the document is shareable and easy to collaborate on with other stakeholders.

tasks.description: Drafting company-wide announcements on Slack, ensuring legal accuracy, compliance, and clarity for employees. This involves summarizing complex legal information into digestible messages, managing internal communication, and obtaining necessary approvals before dissemination.

example.scenario: As Legal Counsel, you are responsible for informing all employees about an important update to the company's data handling policy, which includes new guidelines for using third-party software. The announcement needs to be concise, clear, legally accurate, and delivered via a company-wide Slack channel, highlighting key changes and employee responsibilities.
example.userPrompt: I need to draft a Slack announcement for a company-wide channel regarding our updated data handling policy, specifically focusing on new guidelines for using third-party software. Please summarize the key changes that impact employees, explain the importance of adherence, and provide a call to action for reviewing the full policy document. Ensure the tone is professional and legally sound.

tasks.description: As a Legal Counsel, draft a concise and legally accurate Slack message to summarize key decisions, action items, and next steps from a recent meeting. The follow-up should be clear, assign responsibilities, and maintain a professional tone suitable for internal and potentially external stakeholders involved in a legal matter or project.

example.scenario: You have just concluded an important meeting with internal and external teams regarding the negotiation of a new vendor contract. Several key decisions were made, action items assigned, and deadlines set. You need to send a comprehensive yet concise follow-up to all participants via a dedicated Slack channel to ensure everyone is on the same page and to maintain a formal record of the agreements.
example.userPrompt: As Legal Counsel, draft a Slack message summarizing the key decisions, assigned action items (with owners and deadlines), and next steps from our meeting on the 'Project Phoenix Vendor Contract'. Ensure the tone is professional and legally precise, suitable for both internal and external stakeholders in the '#project-phoenix-contract' channel.

tasks.description: Draft and create effective polls within Slack to gather quick feedback, gauge opinions, or make informal decisions on legal-related matters, ensuring clarity, relevance, and appropriate options for Legal Counsel.

example.scenario: A Legal Counsel needs to quickly poll the legal department regarding their preferred method for receiving new legal updates (e.g., weekly email, monthly meeting, dedicated Slack channel) to optimize internal communication strategies. They also need to ensure the poll options are clear and encourage participation without bias.
example.userPrompt: Create a Slack poll for the legal team. The poll should ask for their preferred method for receiving new legal updates. Provide options for 'Weekly Email Digest', 'Monthly Team Meeting Briefing', 'Dedicated Slack Channel', and 'Other (please specify in comments)'. Include an introductory sentence explaining the purpose is to improve internal communication.

tasks.description: Legal Counsel creates polls within Slack to gather quick team feedback, facilitate decision-making, or gauge sentiment on legal-related topics or team logistics.

example.scenario: A legal team needs to make a quick, non-binding decision on a minor policy interpretation or gather team sentiment on a proposed internal guideline before a formal meeting. The Legal Counsel decides to use a Slack poll to get immediate input.
example.userPrompt: As a Legal Counsel, I need to create a poll in our 'Legal Team Discussion' Slack channel to gather feedback. The poll should ask: 'Should we prioritize reviewing the new data privacy clause updates this week or next week?' The options should be: 'This week', 'Next week', and 'No strong preference'. Please make it anonymous and set it to close in 48 hours.

tasks.task: AI-Assisted Summarization of Slack Channel Discussions for Legal Review
tasks.description: As a legal counsel, leverage an AI assistant integrated with Slack to rapidly summarize lengthy channel discussions, extracting key decisions, action items, potential liabilities, or critical information pertinent to legal compliance, litigation, or contractual matters. This task aims to significantly reduce the time spent sifting through messages, enabling faster legal analysis and advice.

example.scenario: An in-house legal counsel needs to understand the outcome of a complex negotiation discussed over the past week in the '#vendor-contract-renegotiation' Slack channel, to prepare for an upcoming stakeholder meeting. The channel contains hundreds of messages from various team members.
example.userPrompt: Summarize the key points, final agreements, and any unresolved issues from the '#vendor-contract-renegotiation' channel over the past 7 days. Specifically, extract any mentions related to indemnification clauses, payment terms, or intellectual property rights.

tasks.description: Leverage Excel to construct detailed financial models for legal case valuation, settlement analysis, M&A due diligence, or risk assessment, integrating legal considerations into financial projections and strategic advice.

example.scenario: A legal counsel is advising a client on a major class-action lawsuit settlement. They need to present various financial scenarios for the payout structures to the client and assess the long-term financial impact.
example.userPrompt: As a Legal Counsel, build a comprehensive Excel financial model to analyze different settlement options for a class-action lawsuit. The model should project total liabilities, payment schedules, and the impact on the company's cash flow over the next 5-10 years, incorporating probabilities for various legal outcomes to inform negotiation strategy.

tasks.description: Design and implement advanced Excel formulas to analyze legal data, calculate financial implications of cases, track contract terms, or manage legal project budgets. This involves using functions like SUMIFS, INDEX/MATCH, VLOOKUP, array formulas, and potentially VBA-like logic translated into complex cell formulas to handle intricate legal scenarios and reporting requirements.

example.scenario: A legal counsel needs to create a dynamic Excel model to assess the financial risk of a portfolio of active litigation cases. The model must pull data from various sheets, apply different probability weightings to potential outcomes, calculate aggregate liabilities, and summarize projected legal costs based on case complexity and stage.

The 'Financial Projections' tab should use complex formulas to calculate the expected value of potential payouts, considering different settlement scenarios and litigation probabilities. The 'Summary Dashboard' must aggregate these values using formulas like SUMIFS, INDEX/MATCH with multiple criteria, and array formulas to provide a consolidated view of total exposure and average legal costs per case category.

tasks.task: Develop Advanced Excel Formulas for Legal Data Analysis
tasks.description: As a Legal Counsel, create sophisticated Excel formulas to manipulate, analyze, and present complex legal datasets, such as litigation metrics, contract compliance, intellectual property tracking, or financial damages calculations. This involves using nested functions, array formulas, and conditional logic to extract insights and automate reporting.

example.scenario: A legal counsel needs to analyze a large dataset of contract disputes to identify trends, calculate average settlement amounts based on various criteria (e.g., industry, clause type), and flag contracts approaching their renewal or termination dates based on complex date logic. The dataset includes contract IDs, dispute dates, resolution dates, settlement amounts, industries, and relevant clauses. The goal is to generate a summary dashboard from this raw data.

Additionally, I need a separate formula to flag contracts where the 'End Date' is within the next 90 days and the 'Auto-Renew' status is 'Yes', highlighting them for review.

tasks.task: Write Complex Excel Formulas for Legal Data Analysis
tasks.description: Develop sophisticated Excel formulas to analyze legal data, manage case information, calculate damages, or track compliance metrics, requiring advanced Excel functions (e.g., array formulas, INDEX/MATCH with multiple criteria, custom functions) within a legal framework. This is variation 3 of 3, focusing on advanced formula construction and interconnected legal data management.

example.scenario: A legal counsel needs to perform a comprehensive risk assessment for a portfolio of contracts, calculate potential liabilities based on multiple conditional clauses, and track litigation progress across several ongoing cases using a master Excel sheet. The analysis requires dynamic calculations and cross-referencing of various legal parameters.
example.userPrompt: As a Legal Counsel, create an Excel worksheet that automatically calculates the total potential financial exposure for each contract based on several risk factors (e.g., contract value, non-compliance penalties, likelihood of litigation), uses conditional logic to prioritize cases nearing their statute of limitations, and tracks legal fees by case type, all using interconnected, complex formulas. Provide a step-by-step guide on how to build these advanced formulas, including examples of array formulas, OFFSET/INDEX-MATCH combinations, and nested IF statements with multiple criteria for legal decision support.

tasks.task: Automate Legal Document Comparison and Analysis in Excel using VBA
tasks.description: A Legal Counsel requires a VBA macro to perform advanced analysis and comparison of legal data or clauses extracted into Excel spreadsheets. This task involves generating code to compare different versions of contract terms, identify discrepancies in compliance data, or consolidate information from multiple legal documents for reporting, thereby enhancing efficiency and reducing manual review time.

example.scenario: A Legal Counsel regularly receives updated lists of regulatory requirements or contractual clauses across multiple jurisdictions, extracted into separate Excel sheets. They need to generate a VBA macro to efficiently compare the latest version against the previous one, highlighting new additions, deletions, and modifications to clauses or requirements, and summarize these changes into a dedicated report sheet. This helps in quickly assessing compliance impact and tracking contractual deviations.
example.userPrompt: Generate an Excel VBA macro that compares two worksheets (e.g., 'Regulatory Requirements Q1' and 'Regulatory Requirements Q2') within the same workbook. The macro should identify and highlight cells with changed text between corresponding rows/columns, indicate entirely new rows present in Q2 but not Q1, and rows removed from Q1 that are not in Q2. Additionally, it should create a summary sheet listing all identified changes.

tasks.description: As a Legal Counsel, build detailed financial models in Excel to analyze the financial implications of legal cases, M&A transactions, or corporate compliance. This involves projecting costs, revenues, liabilities, and potential financial outcomes to inform legal strategy and business decisions. Focus on structuring data effectively for legal review.

The model should project the target's future cash flows, evaluate potential legal liabilities post-acquisition (e.g., pending lawsuits, regulatory fines), and conduct a sensitivity analysis on key variables such as integration costs, legal due diligence fees, and potential litigation outcomes. tasks.task: Develop financial models for legal case analysis
tasks.description: As a legal counsel, create detailed financial models in Excel to evaluate the monetary implications of legal strategies, settlements, corporate transactions, or compliance risks. This model should include revenue and cost projections, synergy calculations, valuation analysis, and sensitivity analysis to different economic scenarios, to help my client understand the deal's financial implications and negotiate effectively.

tasks.description: A Legal Counsel leveraging GitHub to define, integrate, and review compliance and legal review steps within existing or new CI/CD workflows. This involves scripting requirements for legal approvals, data privacy checks, license compliance scans, and secure development lifecycle (SDLC) gates directly within workflow definitions (e.g., GitHub Actions) to ensure automated adherence to regulatory standards and company policies before code deployment. This role focuses on the legal and compliance aspects of automated deployment pipelines.

example.scenario: A new software project is being initiated that will handle sensitive customer data and requires strict adherence to GDPR and CCPA. The legal department needs to ensure all deployments automatically pass through stringent legal and data privacy compliance checks before reaching production environments. The Legal Counsel is tasked with defining and implementing these gates within the CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions.
example.userPrompt: As a Legal Counsel, draft a GitHub Actions workflow snippet that integrates a mandatory legal review and data privacy compliance check. The workflow must prevent any pull request from being merged or deployed to production without explicit approval from the legal department and successful completion of automated privacy scans. Include placeholders for calling an external compliance service and for manual legal sign-off in the workflow definition.

tasks.task: Design and implement CI/CD workflows for legal compliance on GitHub
tasks.description: Develop CI/CD workflows, specifically GitHub Actions, to integrate legal compliance checks, such as open-source license scanning, data privacy assessments, or regulatory adherence, directly into the software development lifecycle on GitHub. This involves understanding pipeline automation to embed legal requirements early in the development process and ensure automated legal gates.

example.scenario: A legal counsel in a software company needs to ensure that all software releases comply with various data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and open-source license agreements. They want to automate these legal checks within the existing GitHub development workflow to catch issues early and prevent non-compliant code from being deployed. This requires them to understand how to define and integrate these checks into a CI/CD pipeline.
example.userPrompt: As a legal counsel, I need to create a GitHub Actions CI/CD workflow that automatically scans all pull requests for open-source license compatibility and potential data privacy compliance issues before merging to `main`. It should integrate with our existing internal legal compliance reporting tools and block the merge if critical issues are found. Provide a `.github/workflows/legal-compliance.yml` file example that includes placeholder steps for these checks.

tasks.description: A Legal Counsel utilizes GitHub's issue tracking system to review, categorize, prioritize, and track legal-related issues within a software project. This might involve assessing reported compliance risks, reviewing license implications, responding to privacy concerns, or flagging intellectual property issues, ensuring proper assignment and resolution by relevant technical or legal teams.

example.scenario: A new issue has been opened in the company's main software repository on GitHub, titled 'Potential GPL-3.0 Compliance Issue in new dependency'. As Legal Counsel, you need to understand the issue, assign it to the correct engineering manager, and ensure its resolution is tracked.
example.userPrompt: Describe the process a Legal Counsel would follow on GitHub to handle this new issue. Include steps for initial assessment, adding legal specific tags, assigning it, and setting a follow-up reminder or linking to an internal tracking system.

tasks.task: Proactively monitor and manage legal compliance issues on GitHub
tasks.description: Legal counsel uses GitHub to proactively monitor issues, pull requests, and discussions for potential legal risks such as data privacy violations, intellectual property infringement, or open-source license compliance issues. This involves setting up alerts, conducting regular reviews, categorizing identified risks, collaborating with engineering and product teams to implement mitigations, and documenting the compliance process. This variation emphasizes the proactive identification and prevention of legal issues before they escalate.
tasks.mode: Individual, Collaborative (with engineering, product, and security teams)

example.scenario: A legal counsel at a software company is responsible for ensuring that all new open-source projects hosted on GitHub comply with the company's internal licensing policies and do not accidentally expose sensitive company data. They need to establish a workflow for ongoing monitoring.
example.userPrompt: As legal counsel, how can I leverage GitHub's features (issues, pull requests, discussions) to proactively monitor for potential legal compliance risks, such as open-source license violations or accidental data exposure, in new software development projects?

tasks.task: Brainstorm User Flows for Feature Compliance
tasks.description: As Legal Counsel, collaborate in Figma to brainstorm and map out user flows for a new software feature, specifically focusing on identifying potential legal risks, ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA), and integrating legal touchpoints like consent forms, terms of service agreements, or disclaimers directly into the user experience.

Suggest explicit touchpoints for privacy policy acceptance, data usage transparency, and options for users to manage their data preferences within the flow. Propose any modifications to text or flow elements to ensure compliance with GDPR and CCPA, and highlight potential legal risks in the current design.

tasks.task: Generate UX Microcopy with Legal Compliance in Figma

tasks.description: Leverage Figma's collaborative environment to draft, review, and refine legally compliant UX microcopy for various user interface elements, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and adherence to regulatory standards (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) while maintaining a user-friendly and consistent tone. tasks.description: A Legal Counsel needs to quickly grasp the key points of a lengthy legal brief, contract, or discovery document. Focus on identifying any features that might inadvertently lead to disparate impact or raise regulatory flags, and explain how the model arrived at this conclusion in a way that could be presented to a regulator or a client.

tasks.description: As a Legal Counsel, utilize Jupyter Notebooks to interpret and explain the outputs of machine learning models. This involves understanding the rationale behind predictions or classifications, identifying potential biases, ensuring compliance with legal and ethical guidelines, and preparing explanations for internal stakeholders or regulatory bodies. The focus is on clarity, traceability, and risk assessment related to AI/ML decisions.

example.scenario: A financial institution's legal department needs to review the decisions made by an AI model used for credit scoring. Specifically, a customer was denied a loan, and the Legal Counsel needs to understand the model's output in a Jupyter Notebook to ensure the decision is non-discriminatory and compliant with fair lending laws.
example.userPrompt: As Legal Counsel, I need to understand why our AI-powered credit scoring model denied a loan application. Using this Jupyter Notebook, explain the key factors influencing the 'denied' output for a specific applicant (e.g., applicant ID 'CUST-007'). Highlight any features that disproportionately contributed to the negative decision and explain how to verify if these factors align with our fair lending policies and avoid prohibited basis discrimination. Provide a clear, concise interpretation suitable for a regulatory review.

tasks.description: Leveraging a Jupyter Notebook, the Legal Counsel must interpret and explain the outputs of complex AI models, focusing on their legal implications, potential biases, fairness, and compliance risks. This involves translating technical model explanations (e.g., SHAP, LIME) into clear, concise, and actionable legal insights for stakeholders, potentially preparing for regulatory scrutiny or internal policy adjustments.

example.scenario: A financial institution's legal department is reviewing an AI model used for credit risk assessment. The Legal Counsel needs to understand and explain how the model arrives at its decisions, specifically identifying any features that might lead to discriminatory outcomes or non-compliance with fair lending laws. The presentation needs to be delivered to senior legal partners.
example.userPrompt: As Legal Counsel, prepare a Jupyter Notebook to explain the key drivers of our credit risk AI model's decisions. Focus on identifying potential sources of bias, assessing fairness metrics, and highlighting any aspects that could raise legal or regulatory concerns regarding fair lending practices. The explanation should be accessible to legal professionals without deep technical knowledge, translating model insights into clear legal implications and recommendations.

tasks.description: As a Legal Counsel, use Jupyter Notebook to analyze and explain the outputs of an AI model. This involves interpreting complex model decisions, identifying potential biases, ensuring regulatory compliance (e.g., GDPR, fair lending laws), and translating technical explanations into understandable legal terms for stakeholders or regulatory bodies. The focus is on accountability, transparency, and risk assessment related to AI applications.

example.scenario: A legal counsel needs to review an AI model used for insurance claim processing to ensure it adheres to non-discrimination laws and can provide clear, justifiable reasons for claim denials. The data science team has provided a Jupyter Notebook containing the model's predictions, feature importances, and local explanations (e.g., SHAP, LIME values) for several example cases.
example.userPrompt: Given this Jupyter Notebook detailing the AI model's decision for a denied insurance claim (Claim ID: IC98765), analyze the provided SHAP values and feature contributions. Explain, from a legal perspective, why this claim was denied, focusing on identifying any factors that could be perceived as discriminatory or non-compliant with insurance regulations. Outline how this explanation could be presented to a regulatory body or the claimant to ensure transparency and legal defensibility.

tasks.description: Develop Python scripts within Jupyter Notebook to clean and preprocess legal datasets. This involves handling missing values, standardizing formats (e.g., dates, names), correcting common OCR errors in scanned legal documents (contracts, case files), and ensuring data quality for compliance, e-discovery, or legal analytics purposes. The focus is on preparing raw, often unstructured or semi-structured, legal data into a structured and clean format suitable for further legal review and analysis.

example.scenario: A legal firm has acquired a large dataset of historical court documents and client contracts from various sources. The data, after initial OCR and conversion to CSV/JSON, is highly inconsistent, contains numerous typos, irregular date formats, missing information in key fields (e.g., 'Jurisdiction', 'Effective Date', 'Party Names'), and extraneous characters. This messy data prevents accurate analysis for an upcoming regulatory audit and a major litigation case.
example.userPrompt: As a Legal Counsel, your primary goal is to clean and standardize this disorganized legal data. Using Jupyter Notebook, develop Python scripts leveraging libraries like Pandas, re, and NLTK to address the following: identify and handle missing values, correct common OCR errors and misspellings in text fields, standardize date formats (e.g., 'MM/DD/YYYY', 'DD-MMM-YY', 'YYYY-MM-DD'), normalize party names, and remove irrelevant boilerplate text. Your cleaned dataset should be ready for robust legal analysis to support the regulatory audit and litigation strategy.

tasks.description: As a Legal Counsel, leverage Salesforce to compile and summarize a client's complete account history, including key interactions, contractual milestones, support tickets, and any red-flag events, to prepare for litigation, compliance audit, or contract negotiation.

tasks.description: A Legal Counsel uses VS Code to review and explain the legal implications of a given codebase or specific code snippets. This involves identifying potential compliance risks (e.g., data privacy regulations like GDPR/CCPA), intellectual property concerns (e.g., copyright, patent infringement), open-source license adherence, security vulnerabilities with legal ramifications, or contractual obligations related to software development. The explanation focuses on translating technical details into legal assessments and recommendations, often interacting with developers directly within the VS Code environment to understand context.

example.scenario: A software development team has integrated several open-source libraries into a new product. The Legal Counsel needs to review a specific module in VS Code that uses one of these libraries (e.g., licensed under AGPLv3) to ensure compliance with the license terms and identify any potential 'copyleft' obligations or intellectual property risks for the company's proprietary code.
example.userPrompt: Review the `src/integrations/third_party_api_connector.js` file open in VS Code. This module utilizes the 'AGPLv3-licensed-framework'. Provide a concise explanation outlining any legal risks associated with its current use in our proprietary SaaS product, specifically concerning open-source license compliance, potential 'copyleft' obligations, and the implications for our own intellectual property. Suggest actionable steps to mitigate these risks.

tasks.description: As a Legal Counsel, leverage VS Code's environment and integrated AI tools to analyze and explain specific sections of software code. Focus on identifying potential legal risks, intellectual property issues, data privacy implications (e.g., GDPR, CCPA), open-source license compliance, or contractual obligations. The explanation should be simplified for non-technical stakeholders, enabling informed decision-making regarding legal exposure and compliance adherence. This involves understanding code functionality, dependencies, data flows, and potential external interactions.

example.scenario: Your company is integrating a new third-party library into a core product, and concerns have been raised about its open-source license compatibility and potential data handling practices. As Legal Counsel, you've been provided with specific code snippets from the new library in VS Code. You need to understand their functionality, identify any sensitive data processing, assess the implications of the associated open-source license (e.g., AGPL, GPL), and explain these findings to the product and compliance teams, who require a non-technical summary of legal risks and obligations.
example.userPrompt: Using the selected code block, analyze its dependencies, data inputs/outputs, and any potential external calls. Explain its function in plain language, identify all third-party components or libraries used, and assess potential open-source licensing conflicts or data privacy implications. Summarize the key legal risks and compliance requirements for non-technical product managers and compliance officers, suggesting any necessary mitigation steps.

tasks.description: A Legal Counsel uses VS Code to translate specific code segments or pseudocode from one programming language to another (e.g., C++ to Python, or a proprietary DSL to a more common language) for legal due diligence, intellectual property analysis, or compliance review. This task involves understanding the core logic and syntax of the original code, and accurately representing it in a target language, often to simplify it for non-technical stakeholders, identify similarities/differences, or prepare it for integration into legal analysis tools. It requires attention to detail to ensure the legal implications of the code's functionality are preserved in the translation.

example.scenario: A technology company is acquiring a smaller startup, and as Legal Counsel, you are responsible for reviewing the target company's core intellectual property. You've been given a critical algorithm written in an older, less common language (e.g., Delphi Pascal) and need to understand its functionality in the context of patent claims. To facilitate this, and to make it understandable for the acquiring company's engineering team (who primarily use Python), you decide to translate key sections of the Delphi code into Python within VS Code. This translation will help you identify potential infringement risks, confirm unique functionalities, and verify compliance with open-source licenses by making the logic accessible for detailed review.
example.userPrompt: Translate the provided `CoreAlgorithm.pas` (Delphi Pascal) function into Python. Focus on accurately representing the logical flow, data structures, and significant operations. Add comments to explain complex sections and highlight any parts that might relate to specific patent claims or potential open-source components. The goal is to make the Python version clear for legal and technical review to assess intellectual property and compliance.

tasks.task: Translate code for legal review and presentation
tasks.description: A Legal Counsel uses VS Code to translate code snippets or larger codebases into plain legal language. This involves understanding the technical functionality and rephrasing it to clarify legal implications, identify compliance issues, or prepare for expert testimony in intellectual property disputes or regulatory filings. The task requires both coding literacy and legal expertise.

example.scenario: During a patent infringement lawsuit, the opposing party's software code is submitted as evidence. A Legal Counsel needs to analyze specific functions within this code using VS Code, understand their technical purpose, and then translate that understanding into clear, legally relevant explanations for court documents and a non-technical judge/jury.
example.userPrompt: As a Legal Counsel, given this C# code snippet that handles data encryption, explain its precise functionality and identify any potential vulnerabilities or deviations from standard encryption protocols that could be relevant in a cybersecurity liability case. I need to present this in a legal brief. Focus on the method 'EncryptData(byte[] data, string key)' and its usage of 'AES.Create()' in VS Code.

tasks.description: A legal counsel utilizes VS Code to translate text components embedded within application source code (e.g., UI string literals, legal disclaimers, terms of service snippets) or technical documentation formatted as code (e.g., JSON configuration files, YAML specifications, Markdown policy documents). This task is crucial for ensuring international legal compliance, adherence to data protection regulations (like GDPR), and accurate representation of user agreements across different languages. It requires meticulous attention to both linguistic precision and legal nuance within a technical environment.

example.scenario: A multinational software company is launching a new product in several European markets. The legal team needs to ensure that all user-facing legal texts, privacy policy statements embedded within the application's configuration files, and terms of service are accurately translated from English into German, French, and Spanish, aligning with each country's specific legal requirements (e.g., GDPR, local consumer protection laws). The legal counsel, familiar with navigating text files, uses VS Code to review and provide final translations for these critical elements.
example.userPrompt: As a legal counsel, I need to translate the 'privacyPolicyText' field in `config/appSettings.json` and all string literals prefixed with 'LEGAL_' in `src/localization/en.js` from English to German. Ensure the translation accurately reflects GDPR requirements and German consumer law, and highlight any phrases that might be ambiguous or require further legal consultation for the target language. Additionally, review the translated terms of service in `docs/terms_of_service_de.md` for consistency with the translated in-app texts.

tasks.description: A legal counsel uses VS Code to review and translate code snippets or scripts from a programming language into plain English or legal terms, specifically to understand its functionality, data processing, intellectual property implications, or compliance risks, rather than to debug or modify it. This task focuses on comprehension and clear communication for non-technical stakeholders or legal analysis.

example.scenario: As a legal counsel for a software company, you are reviewing a new open-source library that an engineering team proposes to integrate. You need to understand its core functions, especially regarding data input/output, external API calls, and any potential licensing conflicts, to advise on its legal implications. The engineering team has provided you with the library's main Python script.
example.userPrompt: You are a Legal Counsel. Your engineering team has provided a Python script for a new open-source library. Using VS Code, analyze the script to identify its primary functions, how it handles user data (if any), and any calls to external services. Translate these technical details into a concise, plain-English summary for a non-technical executive board, highlighting potential intellectual property or data privacy risks. Focus on explaining 'what it does' rather than 'how it works' in code.

tasks.description: As a Legal Counsel, create custom calculated fields within Tableau to derive new metrics, classifications, or flags from existing legal datasets. This enables deeper analysis of case outcomes, contract terms, regulatory compliance, or other legal data points, allowing for more insightful visualizations and reports without altering the raw data source.

example.scenario: A Legal Counsel is analyzing a dataset of contracts to identify which ones require immediate attention for renewal or review based on their expiration date and performance metrics.
example.userPrompt: As a Legal Counsel, I need to create a calculated field in Tableau called 'Contract Status' that flags contracts as 'Expiring Soon' if their 'Contract End Date' is within the next 60 days, 'Underperforming' if their 'Performance Score' is below 70, and 'Active - Review Needed' if neither of the above but their 'Review Date' is in the past. Otherwise, they should be 'Active - OK'.

tasks.description: As a Legal Counsel, you need to perform in-depth analysis of legal data, such as contract terms, compliance records, or case outcomes. Tableau's Level of Detail (LOD) expressions are crucial for calculating aggregated values at different granularities, allowing you to identify trends, flag anomalies, and support legal arguments with precise data insights that might not be visible with standard aggregations. This task focuses on using LODs to gain advanced analytical insights from complex legal datasets.

example.scenario: You are a Legal Counsel responsible for compliance and risk management. You have a large dataset of regulatory breaches, including 'Breach Type', 'Reporting Quarter', 'Jurisdiction', and 'Penalty Amount'. You need to analyze the average penalty amount per 'Breach Type' across the entire organization, regardless of which 'Jurisdiction' or 'Reporting Quarter' is currently filtered on the dashboard. Additionally, you need to identify the total sum of penalties for the top 5 'Breach Types' that incurred the highest total penalties overall, and compare individual penalties against this organizational average without filter interference.
example.userPrompt:
Using the 'Regulatory Breaches' dataset in Tableau, create two LOD expressions: 
1. An expression named 'Avg Penalty per Breach Type (Org-Wide)' that calculates the average 'Penalty Amount' for each distinct 'Breach Type' across all jurisdictions and quarters, even when filters for 'Jurisdiction' or 'Reporting Quarter' are applied to the view.
2. An expression named 'Total Penalty for Top 5 Breach Types' that sums the 'Penalty Amount' for only the top 5 'Breach Types' (ranked by their total 'Penalty Amount' across the entire dataset) and remains static regardless of filters on 'Jurisdiction' or 'Reporting Quarter'.

tasks.description: As a consultant, you need to design and implement a comprehensive, multi-stage lead nurturing workflow within HubSpot. tasks.description: A consultant needs to generate structured presentation outlines for client engagements, specifically designed for PowerPoint delivery, ensuring logical flow and comprehensive coverage of key topics.

Please include suggested slide titles and bullet points for the following sections: Executive Summary, Current State Analysis & Challenges, Proposed Solutions & Technologies, Implementation Roadmap, Expected ROI & Benefits, and Next Steps.

tasks.description: As a consultant, you need to use PowerPoint to generate detailed outlines for various presentations, ensuring they are well-structured and tailored to the audience and objective. This specific variation focuses on creating outlines for strategic client presentations.

tasks.description: As a consultant, you need to quickly set up a new project repository on GitHub for a client. This involves creating the initial structure, including a README, .gitignore, license, and potentially CI/CD workflow files, to ensure best practices and a smooth start for the development team.

I require a standard `README.md`, a `.gitignore` tailored for a Python web application (Django/Flask), an MIT `LICENSE` file, a basic GitHub Actions workflow for CI, and an initial directory structure including `src`, `tests`, and `docs`. What's the most efficient way to achieve this setup from scratch?

tasks.description: As a consultant, create clear, concise, and audience-specific release notes for a software product hosted on GitHub. This involves translating technical changes into user-friendly language, highlighting key features, bug fixes, and improvements, and formatting them for publication as a GitHub release. Focus on conveying value to stakeholders and end-users.

example.scenario: A client is preparing for a major software update (v2.3) and needs professionally crafted release notes to announce the changes to their user base and internal teams. As a consultant, you are tasked with creating these notes, ensuring they are accurate, engaging, and ready for publication via GitHub Releases.
example.userPrompt: As a consultant, please draft comprehensive release notes for the upcoming v2.3 software release. The release includes a new 'Dark Mode' feature, performance optimizations for data loading, and fixes for three critical security vulnerabilities. Structure the notes for a general audience but also include a brief technical summary for developers. The final output should be suitable for a GitHub release, incorporating markdown formatting for readability.

tasks.description: As a consultant, analyze a set of GitHub pull requests (PRs) to understand the changes, features, bug fixes, and overall progress. This involves reviewing code changes, commit messages, and discussions to create a concise, business-oriented summary suitable for client reports, internal updates, or project assessments. This variation focuses on providing a detailed, interpretative summary.

example.scenario: A lead consultant needs to prepare a weekly progress report for a client. This report requires a clear, non-technical summary of all significant code changes and new features implemented in the past week, based on merged pull requests in their primary development repository.
